Post-Match Reflections: Costa Rica’s coach Gustavo Alfaro stated, “I think we always want to go out there to get three points, but I think this is a good start for us in this group.”

Costa Rica’s midfielder Ariel Lassiter said, “Obviously, with Colombia ahead, they’ve had I don’t know how many games without losing, so I think it’ll be a different beast in Colombia, but we’ll take this point … I think it’ll help us with our confidence to keep on going in this tournament.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brazil delighted the predominantly pro-Brazil crowd, but was never able to breakthrough on the scoreboard or find a late winning goal.
Costa Rica did more defending than attacking and didn’t record its first shot until the 68th minute.
In the 72nd minute, Brazil nearly caught a break as Costa Rican defender Haxzel Quirós nearly put one in his own goal, but goalkeeper Patrick Sequeira was alert, keeping the ball out.
Nearly 10 minutes later, Sequeira was again pressed into action making another game-saving save.
